newsitem.title: ITALY: Olivetti's Caio faces fresh accounts probe.
newsitem.headline: Olivetti's Caio faces fresh accounts probe.

text.p: Francesco Caio, chief executive of crisis-hit Olivetti, faces a further grilling--this time by magistrates from the company's home time of Ivrea on the group's finances, causing its share price on Monday to slump.

Caio, who has headed the loss-making information technology group for just over 10 turbulent weeks, will be questioned in a preliminary probe into the group's accounts by magistrates from the north-western town near Turin, said judicial sources.

The questioning is the first step of an investigation which could lead to a full-scale criminal inquiry into statements made by the struggling group on its financial accounts and follows a similar probe by stock market watchdog authority Consob.

The move unnerved Olivetti shares which fell to a record low of 515 lire before being automatically suspended by the Milan bourse for falling the 10 percent limit-down. After a failed attempt to restart trading, the shares remained suspended.

Ivrea magistrates, who launched their inquiry at the weekend, have questioned former Olivetti director-general in charge of finance and auditing, Renzo Francesconi, after he cast doubts on the accuracy of the group's first half accounts.
